title: Rolling - kinetic energy of sphere and disk

content.question: How do <math alttext="K sub D" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>D</mi> </msub> </math> and <math alttext="K sub S" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>S</mi> </msub> </math> compare, and why?

choices.label: <math alttext="K sub D is greater than K sub S" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> because the sphere will gain less rotational kinetic energy.

<math alttext="K sub D is greater than K sub S" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> because the sphere has a greater acceleration and therefore has less time to gain kinetic energy.

<math alttext="K sub D equals K sub S" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> because both the sphere and disk accelerate at the same rate.

<math alttext="K sub D equals K sub S" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> because the gravitational force does equal work on the sphere and the disk as they roll down the ramp.

content.answer: <math alttext="K sub D equals K sub S" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>S</mi></msub></math> because the gravitational force does equal work on the sphere and the disk as they roll down the ramp.
